required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Fluoroscopically-guided Epidural Block in the Midthoracic Region: A Comparison of Anterioposterior Versus Oblique View Approach

brief_summary.textblock: A comparison of anterioposterior versus oblique view approach method for fluoroscopically-guided epidural block in the midthoracic region. The investigators evaluate differences on total radiation time and technical feasibility between anterioposterior and oblique view approach method.

clinical_study.why_stopped: Terminated due to lack of assistance and time to carry out the research.

primary_outcome.time_frame: immediately ≤1 sec after the confirmation of successful epidural injection
primary_outcome.description: Total radiation exposure time during whole epidural procedure.

secondary_outcome.measure: The number of the needle readjustments
secondary_outcome.time_frame: immediately ≤1 sec after the confirmation of successful epidural injection
secondary_outcome.description: The number of the needle readjustments for successful epidural injection

clinical_study.condition: Low Back Pain Requiring Epidural Injection

arm_group.description: oblique view approach during transforaminal epidural block
oblique view approach during transforaminal epidural block

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adult patients who were scheduled for the transforaminal epidural injection in midthoracic region (T5-T7)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Local anesthetic allergy, coagulopathy

facility.name: Department of Anesthesiology and Pain Medicine, Yonsei University College of Medicine
